timeline.bodyText: Is it needed as an attribute? I think just passing it in the constructor should be sufficient.
timeline.author: ahornace

timeline.bodyText: Hmm, it seems we are having too many arguments. I'll try to think of something (builder, etc.). Feel free to ignore for now.
timeline.author: ahornace
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -124,8 +134,8 @@ public Suggester(
             final boolean projectsEnabled,
             final Set<String> allowedFields,
             final int timeThreshold,
-            final int rebuildParallelismLevel
-    ) {
+            final int rebuildParallelismLevel,
+            MeterRegistry registry) {

timeline.message: convert registry attribute to local variable

timeline.bodyText:
Now that I think about it. Does not Timer include also a Counter by default? In the code it seems it does: https://github.com/micrometer-metrics/micrometer/blob/master/implementations/micrometer-registry-prometheus/src/main/java/io/micrometer/prometheus/PrometheusTimer.java
Could you please check if you can plot it in Grafana?
timeline.author: ahornace

replies.bodyText:
Indeed it does. I wanted to mention it previously that I'd like to keep it separate.
$ curl -X GET -s http://foo/source/metrics/prometheus | grep ^suggest
suggester_init_latency_seconds_count 1.0
suggester_init_latency_seconds_sum 0.035
suggester_init_latency_seconds_max 0.0
suggester_rebuild_latency_seconds_max 0.0
suggester_rebuild_latency_seconds_count 30.0
suggester_rebuild_latency_seconds_sum 0.012
suggester_rebuild_total 30.0
replies.author: vladak
